trans-unit.source: Contains information about a button in a toolbar

seg-source.mrk: Contains information about a button in a toolbar

target.mrk: Contains information about a button in a toolbar

trans-unit.source: 0-based index of the button image. Set this member to $I_IMAGECALLBACK, and the toolbar will send the $TBN_GETDISPINFO notification to retrieve the image index when it is needed.

seg-source.mrk: Set this member to $I_IMAGECALLBACK, and the toolbar will send the $TBN_GETDISPINFO notification to retrieve the image index when it is needed.

target.mrk: Set this member to $I_IMAGECALLBACK, and the toolbar will send the $TBN_GETDISPINFO notification to retrieve the image index when it is needed.

trans-unit.source: Set this member to $I_IMAGENONE to indicate that the button does not have an image. The button layout will not include any space for a bitmap, only text.

seg-source.mrk: Set this member to $I_IMAGENONE to indicate that the button does not have an image.
The button layout will not include any space for a bitmap, only text.

target.mrk: Set this member to $I_IMAGENONE to indicate that the button does not have an image.
The button layout will not include any space for a bitmap, only text.

trans-unit.source: If the button is a separator, Bitmap determines the width of the separator, in pixels.

seg-source.mrk: If the button is a separator, Bitmap determines the width of the separator, in pixels.

target.mrk: If the button is a separator, Bitmap determines the width of the separator, in pixels.

trans-unit.source: Command identifier associated with the button. This identifier is used in a $WM_COMMAND message when the button is chosen.

seg-source.mrk: Command identifier associated with the button.
This identifier is used in a $WM_COMMAND message when the button is chosen.

target.mrk: Command identifier associated with the button.
This identifier is used in a $WM_COMMAND message when the button is chosen.

trans-unit.source: 0-based index of the button string, or a pointer to a string that contains text for the button

seg-source.mrk: 0-based index of the button string, or a pointer to a string that contains text for the button

target.mrk: 0-based index of the button string, or a pointer to a string that contains text for the button
